page.title: 11THE ANTIQUE TRADE IN NORFOLK
page.content: My name is James Nisbet.I was born in Wimbledon and I attend Aldborough School.My father is an antique dealer and decided to move to Norfolk when I was three years old.We originally lived in Gresham and then Thurgarton trading from home.The economic climate and high rise in petrol prices made trading difficult so we moved to market town of Aylsham.Dealing in Norfolk involves travelling great distances.We buy from sales,other shops and the public.Car boot sales,a recent craze are good hunting grounds.In suburbia people often dispose of unwanted articles to the dustcart but in Norfolk they take their clutter to dead stock sales like Keys of Aylsham.Items of special interest are saved from destruction by knowledgeable dealers.
